item.title: pianogal add a quote by Diane Keaton
item.description: "What is perfection, anyway? It's the death of creativity, that's what I think, while change on the other hand, is the cornerstone of new ideas. God knows I want new ideas and new experiences" -- Diane Keaton

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, therefore, is not an act, but a habit." -- Aristotle

item.title: pianogal add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Matthew Bomer
item.description: "When singing Journey, you have to commit." -- Matthew Bomer

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation." -- Yann Martel

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Jean de La Fontaine
item.description: "A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it." -- Jean de La Fontaine

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Ted Hughes
item.description: "The only calibration that counts is how much heart people invest, how much they ignore their fears of being hurt or caught out or humiliated. And the only thing people regret is that they didn't live boldly enough, that they didn't invest enough heart, didn't love enough. Nothing else really counts at all." -- Ted Hughes

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Jean de La Bruyère
item.description: "Those who make the worst use of their time are the first to complain of its brevity." -- Jean de La Bruyère

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Sophocles
item.description: "Fortune is not on the side of the faint-hearted." -- Sophocles

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Brevity is the soul of lingerie." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "Your silence will not protect you." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Don't gobblefunk around with words." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: pianogal add a quote by China Miéville
item.description: "A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge." -- China Miéville

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld
item.description: "Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire." -- Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach
item.description: "To be content with little is difficult; to be content with much, impossible." -- Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: pianogal add a quote by George S. Patton
item.description: "If everybody is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking." -- George S. Patton

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: pianogal add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore
